page.title: 16RELIGION I
page.content: The majority of people in Ballycastle are{Roman Catholic}although those in the surrounding areas are mainly{ {Protestant.}There are four churches in our area: there is one{Presbyterian} church, two{Church of Ireland}churches and one{Roman Catholic}church; there is also a Gospel Hall near the hospital. The Roman Catholic church is on Moyle Road, beside the two Catholic primary schools and opposite Cross and Passion College. Marconi used the spire of this church for his early wireless work. The Presbyterian church is on Castle St. fairly near to the hospital. The two Church of Ireland churches are in the Diamond and on the Ramoan Rd. The older of the two,in the Diamond is opposite the Antrim Arms Hotel.
